title: The world’s most valuable public company just laid out its vision for the future
description: By Clare Duffy, CNN New York (CNN) — Nvidia, already the world leader in chips crucial for artificial intelligence, wants to make its technology central to everyday life. That means everything from cell phone towers to robotic factories to self-driving cars, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced in his first-ever keynote address at the company’s GTC

title: From chaos to code: why AI is boosting developer ranks
description: Artificial intelligence tools are inspiring more people to create their own software and could help to address Australia's skills gap.
content:
Artificial intelligence technology is not just helping to create more software but to create more software developers after a leading platform added a record 36 million users in one year.

title: Nvidia to build AI supercomputers for US Enegry Department, signs $500B deal
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said on Tuesday that the artificial intelligence chip leader will build seven new supercomputers for the Energy Department, and said the company has $500 billion in bookings for its AI chips.
content:
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said on Tuesday that the artificial intelligence chip leader will build seven new supercomputers for the Energy Department, and said the company has $500 billion in bookings for its AI chips.

title: Elon Musk launches Grokipedia to rival ‘left-biased’ Wikipedia
description: The website’s content is generated by artificial intelligence and generative AI assistant Grok.
content:
Elon Musk’s company xAI has launched a website called Grokipedia to compete with online encyclopaedia Wikipedia, which he and others on the American right wing have accused of ideological bias.
The site, dubbed version 0.1, had more than 885,000 arti... [812 chars]

title: Amazon Could Cut Over 30,000 Jobs for Focus on AI
description: The company is re-evaluating pandemic spending and overhiring as it continues to assess the impact of artificial intelligence on its workflow.
content:
According to Reuters, Amazon is planning to potentially lay off at least 30,000 corporate jobs. The move comes as the company looks to adjust for overspending during the pandemic, and could represent a downsizing of 10% of its corporate employees.
